pd: the cake is a lie
Amazing Game
It's ok
the cake is a lie

This is a very nice game to play when you want a classic puzzle game. Not too difficult but not too easy either. Though there is very little play hours involved with the game, it still is nice to go back from time to time to play a level. Speaking of, the levels are short too. So you could easily bust this game out in a few hours. The achievements are simple yet, will require multiple playthroughs as some do not unlock until after you beat the game once. The graphics are dated a little but the gameplay offsets that and you hardly notice this. Portal is a very simplistic game, and a must have for any gamers game collection.

Cronolog√≠a los juegos de Valve una ideas nueva para Remaker

1-Portal eventos de Aperture Science con GLaDOS las muertes de personal de Aperture

2-Eventos de black mesa con la teletransportacion experimentando los cristales de sen abre la puerta a la tierra de chen por accidente de uno trabajador de black mesa el nombre Gord Freeman


nuevo universo de juego de valve por nueva historia  ;)
M√°s corto que hacerse una paja a la crema, pero igual de intenso, as√≠ que deja ya el pto csgo y ju√©galo.

[h1]Spa√ü mit Portalen[/h1]

[h1]Story[/h1]
Ihr erwacht in einem verschlossenen Raum. An der Wand z√§hlt ein Countdown nach unten und ihr habt keinen Schimmer, wer ihr seid, wo ihr herkommt, noch was das alles hier soll. *DING* Die Kammer √∂ffnet sich, eine Computerstimme beginnt mit euch zu sprechen und ihr stellt fest, dass ihr euch offensichtlich in einer Art Testkammer befindet. Schritt f√ºr Schritt ohne Fragen zu stellen, folgt ihr den Anweisungen der Computerstimme, die mit fortlaufenden Tests einen immer seltsameren Humor zu entwickeln scheint‚Ä¶

[i]"Hier ist dein Ergebnis der letzten Kammer: Du bist ein schrecklicher Mensch. Ja, das steht hier: Schrecklicher Mensch. Und das testen wir nicht einmal."[/i]

[h1]Rein & Raus[/h1]
Nein, nicht dieses rein und raus du Ferkel, hier geht es um Portale. Je schneller du hineinspringst, desto schneller kommst du auf der anderen Seite wieder heraus. Das ist eine von vielen M√∂glichkeiten, die Macht der Portale zu nutzen um die verschiedenen Testkammern des Spiels zu absolvieren. Ihr steuert die Protagonistin per Maus & Tastatur wie bei einem Ego-Shooter. Nur mit dem kleinen aber feinen Unterschied, dass ihr nicht mit einer Waffe, sondern das Handheld Portal Device. Mit Hilfe dieser ‚ÄûKnarre‚Äú k√∂nnt ihr zwei verschiedene Portale erzeugen, die definitiv zum Experimentieren einladen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1708151736

[h1]Grafik & Sound[/h1]
Tja wer kennt sie nicht, die Source Engine. Sie leistet immer noch wunderbare  Dienste und mit allen Reglern am Anschlag braucht sie sich auch 2019 nicht zu verstecken. Es entsteht ein wunderbar fl√ºssiges Spielgef√ºhl, welches stets mit der atmosph√§risch passenden Hintergrundmusik abgerundet wird. Lediglich die Sounds wirken mittlerweile wirklich altbacken, √§hnlich wie bei Half-Life. Ansonsten ist die englische Sprecherin zu bevorzugen, zumal die einfach noch viel verr√ºckter r√ºberkommt, als die deutsche Version.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1708809586

[h1]Umfang[/h1]
Das Spiel ist relativ kurz, wird einem auf Steam aber auch seit Jahren f√ºr wenig bis gar kein Geld hinterhergeschmissen. Von 3-10h ist alles drin, je nachdem ob ihr nur durchspielen wollt oder auch alle Achievements haben m√∂chtet, die machen das Spiel n√§mlich gleich um ein paar Stufen kniffliger.


[h1]FAZIT:[/h1]
Ein Fest f√ºr Puzzle-Gamer oder jene die es noch werden m√∂chte.
Ein super Einstiegsspiel als Warm-Up f√ºr Portal 2 oder grandiose Games a la The Talos Principle.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1708151921

Short puzzle game BUT WORTH
‰ªÄ‰πàÊó∂ÂÄôÊâç‰ºöÊï∞3

Story: 8/10
Graphics: 9/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Audio: 6/10
Stability: 10/10

Portal is a must play puzzle game. It is short, but amazing in its own rite. The story is hilarious and elevates the game from a puzzle game into a video game cult-classic. Puzzles get logarithmicaly harder, but they were never seriously challenging. Furthermore, Portal has aged very well and is just as fun now as it was the day it was released.
Great game lots of portals

I put off buying this game for the longest time because I never wanted to pay $10 for it. Steam gave a amazing deal for all Valve games and I was able to buy the bundle! I loved the game and Glados is my favorite antagonist. The story is indeed short, but it grows on you the more you play it. I highly recommend playing Portal 2 as it furthers the story and makes the game so much more memorable. I don't think a Portal 3 should ever happen as this game ended perfectly, however a game based off of main character's life afterwards would be amazing!

Thanks Valve For Such A Nice Game, And Story

Even years after release it's one of my favourite single player experiences. The game concept is so unique and the story captivating. It's the perfect balance of story and puzzle put together in one cohesive package. 

The puzzles are challenging yet logical and very enjoyable to beat. There's even cake at the end.

This game was truly ahead of its time and built in the age of producing incredible, immersive content in order to draw in customers, rather that the yearly released soulless garbage most developer/publishers throw out now to the pre-built fanbase.
ƒ∞stanbulun se√ßim sonu√ßlarƒ± daha uzun s√ºrd√º aq bu ne.
ÏµúÏ¥àÎ°ú Ìï¥Î≥∏ Î≤®Î∏åÍ≤åÏûÑ! Ïû¨Î∞åÏóàÏùå

Short game, so I'll give it only one word: [u]Amazing![/u]

This is a puzzle game with a very simple concept consisting of shooting blue and orange portals in order to get from one to another. Seems pretty easy, right? However, it opens more possibilities other than that and, sometimes, you have to think outside of the box.
This game has a very interesting story: you're a test subject who's working on something apparently harmless with the help of a computer who communicates with you. But... I won't spoil it for those who haven't played this gem yet.
I don't really care about graphics, but this game has nice enough graphics for a game over a decade old. It will run very smoothly on any modern computer. The frame rate is below what we are used to see as of 2019, but, personally, I wasn't bothered by that.

I recommend playing this game if you're passionate about videogames, if you're new in the gaming community, if you're looking for a challenge... I recommend this game to any player. (Also, if you like this game play [i]Portal 2[/i])

Verdict: 9.5/10.

As I usually do, I'll finish this review by congratulating everyone who worked on this amazing game: [b]Congratulations, Valve![/b]

It's about time I played this classic. The whole game was 90% tutorial and it really was quite a good time learning how to take on puzzle after puzzle. I didn't really feel agitated or frustrated like I do with a lot of puzzle games since Portal lets me do whatever I want and face the consequences. So it left me a cathartic feeling when I finished it.
